alert.note: Alert for Jefferson; Orleans; Plaquemines; St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 19 at 10:02PM CDT until June 19 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: The National Weather Service in New Orleans has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern St. Bernard Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Southwestern Orleans Parish in southeastern Louisiana... North central Jefferson Parish in southeastern Louisiana... Northwestern Plaquemines Parish in southeastern Louisiana... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 1001 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near East New Orleans, moving south at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Marrero, Harvey, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Jefferson, Gretna, Westwego, Woodmere, Violet, Terrytown, Meraux, Poydras, Estelle and Arabi. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 232 and 243. Interstate 610 between mile markers 2 and 4. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is capable of producing widespread wind damage across around the New Orleans metro. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
